name: nerdlog
description: TUI log viewer with timeline histogram and no central server

repo.name: nerdlog
repo.description: Nerdlog: fast, remote-first, multi-host TUI log viewer with timeline histogram and no central server

readme.summary: Excellent clarity and motivation with strong installation guidance, but lacks inline troubleshooting and the README cuts off mid-sentence.
readme.top_issue: README appears incomplete (cuts off at 'Requirements' section) and troubleshooting is referenced in external docs rather than providing inline solutions for common issues

injection_risks.description: The flagSet variable is used to set initial option values, but it does not validate or sanitize the input. This could potentially lead to command injection if an attacker can manipulate the input.
The cmdWithOpts struct contains a cmd field that is not validated or sanitized. However, it appears to be used internally and not directly influenced by user input.

critical_findings: potential command injection vulnerability through flagSet variable
security.summary: The nerdlog package has some security concerns, including potential command injection vulnerabilities and exposure of sensitive information, but overall it appears to be well-structured and secure.

common_complaints: Limited SSH config parsing and complexity with ~/.ssh/config
Timestamp format detection failures for common log formats (Apache, httpd)
UI limitations (truncated message lines, no easy reset to default view)
Missing quality-of-life features (auto-refresh, persistent configuration, bash completion)
praise_themes: Tool is considered 'nice' and 'great' for its core functionality
Active development with recent feature additions (external ssh binary support)
sentiment.summary: Active project with engaged maintainer addressing real user pain points; community sentiment is constructive rather than frustrated, but feature gaps in log format support and SSH handling are causing friction for broader adoption.

communication.summary: Maintainer responses are generally helpful and clear, showing patience with users and a good level of technical depth.

concerns: No commits in past 6 months despite last commit in June 2025
15 open issues with no recent activity or resolution
Zero closed issues in past 6 months indicating no bug fixes
No merged PRs in past 6 months showing no contributions accepted
No active contributors in past 6 months
Unknown last release date suggests release cycle has stopped
maintenance.summary: The nerdlog package appears abandoned with no maintenance activity for at least 6 months and a backlog of unresolved issues.

changelog.summary: The changelog is well-categorized and appears comprehensive, but lacks clear marking of breaking changes and migration guides.

project_metrics.description: Nerdlog: fast, remote-first, multi-host TUI log viewer with timeline histogram and no central server

analysis_summary.doc_summary: The README provides a good overview of the package, but could benefit from more concise language and additional troubleshooting information.
concerns: No commits in the past six months, indicating a lack of recent development or updates.
Only one merged PR in the past six months, suggesting limited community contribution and maintenance.
Docs: Lack of clear and concise troubleshooting section
Security: potential command injection vulnerability through flagSet variable
High bus factor risk (96% from top contributor)
highlights: Three contributors active in the past six months, showing some level of ongoing engagement.
Recent release within the last six months
